anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
when did the celebrities enter the big brother house
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['Six celebrity housemates entered the Big Brother House in Vietnam on July 4, 2016. The last three housemates entered the next day; they were delayed due to immigration problems.\n', 'The fifth UK series of "Celebrity Big Brother" began on Wednesday 3 January 2007. On the first day, eleven celebrity housemates entered the Big Brother House, including model Danielle Lloyd, singer Jo O\'Meara and Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty. Then, on Friday 5, former "Big Brother" housemate Jade Goody entered the house, accompanied by her boyfriend Jack Tweed and her mother Jackiey Budden. Each day, Channel 4 broadcast a daily "highlights" show, featuring selected events of the previous 24 hours in the House, which itself was repeated the following morning, although offensive language and other potentially objectionable content was removed for pre-watershed broadcasting.\n', 'On 3 January 2017, Block entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house. He voluntarily left the house on Day 10.\n', 'The show went live on 18 August. A group of ten initial housemates entered the house through the big eye via a catwalk leading up to a flight of steps, crossing a swingbridge shaped like the Big Brother eye. Marcus Bentley narrated each contestant\'s details as they made their entrance. Kerry Katona was announced as the first celebrity housemate to enter the new "Big Brother" house followed by American Pie actress Tara Reid Reality TV stars Paddy Doherty from "My Big Fat Gypsy Wedding" and Amy Childs from ITV 2\'s "The Only Way Is Essex" joined them. Australian paparazzi and media personality Darryn Lyons was next to join the house followed by Sally Bercow. British actor Lucien Laviscount was next with ex "Baywatch" actress Pamela Bach preceding him. British model Bobby Sabel was next, with Irish pop duo Jedward the last to enter the house.\n', 'On 22 August 2013, Spence entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house to participate in the twelfth series. On the first day, he was chosen to be a \'Cult celebrity\' meaning he had the power to nominate housemates for the first eviction. Throughout his time in the house, Spence survived three evictions, however he was evicted two days before the final.\n', 'Clark-Neal became a housemate in the eleventh series of "Celebrity Big Brother" in January 2013. He was the second celebrity to enter the Big Brother House. On launch night, he and Italian jockey Frankie Dettori selected which celebrities would join them in the House and who would be banished to the Basement. It was revealed mid-way through the series that, contrary to the show\'s rules of staying in the Big Brother House throughout the series, Clark-Neal had been leaving the house each Sunday to rehearse for "The X Factor Live Tour", which began a day after the live final on 25 January. He made it to the final five, alongside Neil "Razor" Ruddock, Claire Richards, Ryan Moloney, and Heidi Montag and Spencer Pratt (Heidi & Spencer being counted as a single housemate). Clark-Neal was announced as the winner during the live final, after which he broke down into tears.\n', '"Celebrity Big Brother", also known as "Big Brother: Celebrity Edition", is the American adaptation of the reality competition television franchise "Celebrity Big Brother", which was created by John de Mol. The series premiered on CBS as counterprogramming to NBC\'s coverage of the 2018 Winter Olympics on February 7, 2018. The series has aired for two seasons and focuses on a group of celebrities, known as HouseGuests, that live in a purpose built house, known as the Big Brother house, with no contact from the outside world for approximately a month. The HouseGuests try to avoid eviction with the aim of being the last remaining HouseGuest in order to win a grand prize of $250,000. Allison Grodner and Rich Meehan serve as executive producers and the show is produced by Fly on the Wall Entertainment in association with Endemol Shine North America. Julie Chen Moonves continues her role as host of the series, a position she has held since "Big Brother" premiered on CBS in 2000. It is filmed in Los Angeles.\n', 'In August 2011, he appeared in a "New Tricks" episode titled \'Half Life\' as a prisoner. On 27 August 2015, he entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house. He was evicted on 8 September 2015.\n', 'On 2 January 2009, Malone entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house. She was the seventh person to enter and was immediately picked up on her loudness. On 16 January, Malone was the second person to be evicted from the "Celebrity Big Brother" House.\n', 'Press interviews were filmed on June 17, 2014, the cast was announced on June 19, 2014 and the HouseGuests moved into the "Big Brother" house on June 20, 2014. "Big Brother 16" began with a two-night premiere on June 25–26, 2014. On June 25, 2014, five days after the HouseGuests moved into the "Big Brother" house, eight of the 16 HouseGuests—Amber, Cody, Devin, Donny, Frankie, Joey, Nicole and Paola—were introduced, shown entering the house and taking part in the first HoH competition of the season, while on June 26, the eight HouseGuests who were not introduced the night before—Brittany, Caleb, Christine, Derrick, Hayden, Jocasta, Victoria and Zach—were introduced, shown entering the house and taking part in the second HoH competition. It was on the June 26 episode that the Team America and Battle of the Block twists were revealed.\n']

On the first day, eleven celebrity housemates entered the Big Brother House, including model Danielle Lloyd, singer Jo O'Meara and Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty. Then, on Friday 5, former "Big Brother" housemate Jade Goody entered the house, accompanied by her boyfriend Jack Tweed and her mother Jackiey Budden. Each day, Channel 4 broadcast a daily "highlights" show, featuring selected events of the previous 24 hours in the House, which itself was repeated the following morning, although offensive language and other potentially objectionable content was removed for pre-watershed broadcasting.
', 'On 3 January 2017, Block entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house. He voluntarily left the house on Day 10.
', 'The show went live on 18 August. A group of ten initial housemates entered the house through the big eye via a catwalk leading up to a flight of steps, crossing a swingbridge shaped like the Big Brother eye. Marcus Bentley narrated each contestant's details as they made their entrance. Kerry Katona was announced as the first celebrity housemate to enter the new "Big Brother" house followed by American Pie actress Tara Reid Reality TV stars Paddy Doherty from "My Big Fat Gypsy Wedding" and Amy Childs from ITV 2's "The Only Way Is Essex" joined them. Australian paparazzi and media personality Darryn Lyons was next to join the house followed by Sally Bercow. British actor Lucien Laviscount was next with ex "Baywatch" actress Pamela Bach preceding him. British model Bobby Sabel was next, with Irish pop duo Jedward the last to enter the house.
', 'On 22 August 2013, Spence entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house to participate in the twelfth series. On the first day, he was chosen to be a 'Cult celebrity' meaning he had the power to nominate housemates for the first eviction. Throughout his time in the house, Spence survived three evictions, however he was evicted two days before the final.
', 'Clark-Neal became a housemate in the eleventh series of "Celebrity Big Brother" in January 2013. He was the second celebrity to enter the Big Brother House. On launch night, he and Italian jockey Frankie Dettori selected which celebrities would join them in the House and who would be banished to the Basement. It was revealed mid-way through the series that, contrary to the show's rules of staying in the Big Brother House throughout the series, Clark-Neal had been leaving the house each Sunday to rehearse for "The X Factor Live Tour", which began a day after the live final on 25 January. He made it to the final five, alongside Neil "Razor" Ruddock, Claire Richards, Ryan Moloney, and Heidi Montag and Spencer Pratt (Heidi & Spencer being counted as a single housemate). Clark-Neal was announced as the winner during the live final, after which he broke down into tears.
', '"Celebrity Big Brother", also known as "Big Brother: Celebrity Edition", is the American adaptation of the reality competition television franchise "Celebrity Big Brother", which was created by John de Mol. The series premiered on CBS as counterprogramming to NBC's coverage of the 2018 Winter Olympics on February 7, 2018. The series has aired for two seasons and focuses on a group of celebrities, known as HouseGuests, that live in a purpose built house, known as the Big Brother house, with no contact from the outside world for approximately a month. The HouseGuests try to avoid eviction with the aim of being the last remaining HouseGuest in order to win a grand prize of $250,000. Allison Grodner and Rich Meehan serve as executive producers and the show is produced by Fly on the Wall Entertainment in association with Endemol Shine North America. Julie Chen Moonves continues her role as host of the series, a position she has held since "Big Brother" premiered on CBS in 2000. It is filmed in Los Angeles.
', 'In August 2011, he appeared in a "New Tricks" episode titled 'Half Life' as a prisoner. On 27 August 2015, he entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house. He was evicted on 8 September 2015.
', 'On 2 January 2009, Malone entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house. She was the seventh person to enter and was immediately picked up on her loudness. On 16 January, Malone was the second person to be evicted from the "Celebrity Big Brother" House.
', 'Press interviews were filmed on June 17, 2014, the cast was announced on June 19, 2014 and the HouseGuests moved into the "Big Brother" house on June 20, 2014. "Big Brother 16" began with a two-night premiere on June 25–26, 2014. On June 25, 2014, five days after the HouseGuests moved into the "Big Brother" house, eight of the 16 HouseGuests—Amber, Cody, Devin, Donny, Frankie, Joey, Nicole and Paola—were introduced, shown entering the house and taking part in the first HoH competition of the season, while on June 26, the eight HouseGuests who were not introduced the night before—Brittany, Caleb, Christine, Derrick, Hayden, Jocasta, Victoria and Zach—were introduced, shown entering the house and taking part in the second HoH competition. It was on the June 26 episode that the Team America and Battle of the Block twists were revealed.
']

Task Description:
Please extract content from these passages that can help enhance the model's causal reasoning and logical inference abilities.
consolidate these contents, and analyze how the selected information may impact the improvement of the model's causal reasoning and logical inference capabilities.

To enhance the model's causal reasoning and logical inference abilities, we can extract and consolidate relevant information from the provided passages regarding the entry dates of celebrities into the Big Brother house. Here’s a summary of the key points:

1. **Vietnam Celebrity Big Brother**: Six celebrity housemates entered on **July 4, 2016**; three more entered the following day due to immigration issues.
  
2. **UK Celebrity Big Brother (2007)**: Eleven celebrity housemates entered on **January 3, 2007**. Additional housemates entered on **January 5, 2007**.

3. **Celebrity Big Brother (2017)**: A contestant named Block entered on **January 3, 2017**.

4. **UK Celebrity Big Brother (August 2011)**: A contestant entered the house on **August 27, 2015** and was evicted on **September 8, 2015**.

5. **Celebrity Big Brother (2009)**: Malone entered the house on **January 2, 2009**.

6. **Big Brother 16 (2014)**: HouseGuests moved in on **June 20, 2014**, with introductions occurring on **June 25-26, 2014**.

### Analysis of Impact on Causal Reasoning and Logical Inference

1. **Temporal Relationships**: The extracted dates provide a clear timeline of events, which is crucial for understanding the sequence of actions (e.g., entry dates of housemates). This helps the model learn to establish temporal relationships, a fundamental aspect of causal reasoning.

2. **Causal Links**: The mention of delays (e.g., immigration problems causing a delay in entry) illustrates how certain events can influence subsequent actions. This can help the model understand causality—how one event can lead to another.

3. **Event Clustering**: The information about multiple entries on specific dates allows the model to recognize patterns, such as how reality shows often introduce contestants in groups. This can enhance the model's ability to infer general rules from specific instances.

4. **Contextual Understanding**: By analyzing the context in which celebrities enter the house (e.g., the format of the show, the number of contestants), the model can better understand the implications of these entries on the show's dynamics, which is essential for logical inference.

5. **Comparative Analysis**: The different series and their respective entry dates allow for comparative reasoning. The model can learn to differentiate between various iterations of the show and their unique characteristics, improving its ability to generalize from specific examples.

### Conclusion

The consolidated information from the passages enhances the model's causal reasoning and logical inference capabilities by providing a structured understanding of events, their sequences, and the relationships between them. This structured approach allows the model to better predict outcomes, understand dependencies, and draw logical conclusions based on the information provided.

Here is an answer generated by a language model with the reasoning process.

question_info.question: when did the celebrities enter the big brother house
passages:
Six celebrity housemates entered the Big Brother House in Vietnam on July 4, 2016. The last three housemates entered the next day; they were delayed due to immigration problems.
The fifth UK series of "Celebrity Big Brother" began on Wednesday 3 January 2007. On the first day, eleven celebrity housemates entered the Big Brother House, including model Danielle Lloyd, singer Jo O'Meara and Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty. Then, on Friday 5, former "Big Brother" housemate Jade Goody entered the house, accompanied by her boyfriend Jack Tweed and her mother Jackiey Budden. Each day, Channel 4 broadcast a daily "highlights" show, featuring selected events of the previous 24 hours in the House, which itself was repeated the following morning, although offensive language and other potentially objectionable content was removed for pre-watershed broadcasting.
On 3 January 2017, Block entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house. He voluntarily left the house on Day 10.
The show went live on 18 August. A group of ten initial housemates entered the house through the big eye via a catwalk leading up to a flight of steps, crossing a swingbridge shaped like the Big Brother eye. Marcus Bentley narrated each contestant's details as they made their entrance. Kerry Katona was announced as the first celebrity housemate to enter the new "Big Brother" house followed by American Pie actress Tara Reid Reality TV stars Paddy Doherty from "My Big Fat Gypsy Wedding" and Amy Childs from ITV 2's "The Only Way Is Essex" joined them. Australian paparazzi and media personality Darryn Lyons was next to join the house followed by Sally Bercow. British actor Lucien Laviscount was next with ex "Baywatch" actress Pamela Bach preceding him. British model Bobby Sabel was next, with Irish pop duo Jedward the last to enter the house.
On 22 August 2013, Spence entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house to participate in the twelfth series. On the first day, he was chosen to be a 'Cult celebrity' meaning he had the power to nominate housemates for the first eviction. Throughout his time in the house, Spence survived three evictions, however he was evicted two days before the final.
Clark-Neal became a housemate in the eleventh series of "Celebrity Big Brother" in January 2013. He was the second celebrity to enter the Big Brother House. On launch night, he and Italian jockey Frankie Dettori selected which celebrities would join them in the House and who would be banished to the Basement. It was revealed mid-way through the series that, contrary to the show's rules of staying in the Big Brother House throughout the series, Clark-Neal had been leaving the house each Sunday to rehearse for "The X Factor Live Tour", which began a day after the live final on 25 January. He made it to the final five, alongside Neil "Razor" Ruddock, Claire Richards, Ryan Moloney, and Heidi Montag and Spencer Pratt (Heidi & Spencer being counted as a single housemate). Clark-Neal was announced as the winner during the live final, after which he broke down into tears.
"Celebrity Big Brother", also known as "Big Brother: Celebrity Edition", is the American adaptation of the reality competition television franchise "Celebrity Big Brother", which was created by John de Mol. The series premiered on CBS as counterprogramming to NBC's coverage of the 2018 Winter Olympics on February 7, 2018. The series has aired for two seasons and focuses on a group of celebrities, known as HouseGuests, that live in a purpose built house, known as the Big Brother house, with no contact from the outside world for approximately a month. The HouseGuests try to avoid eviction with the aim of being the last remaining HouseGuest in order to win a grand prize of $250,000. Allison Grodner and Rich Meehan serve as executive producers and the show is produced by Fly on the Wall Entertainment in association with Endemol Shine North America. Julie Chen Moonves continues her role as host of the series, a position she has held since "Big Brother" premiered on CBS in 2000. It is filmed in Los Angeles.
In August 2011, he appeared in a "New Tricks" episode titled 'Half Life' as a prisoner. On 27 August 2015, he entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house. He was evicted on 8 September 2015.
On 2 January 2009, Malone entered the "Celebrity Big Brother" house. She was the seventh person to enter and was immediately picked up on her loudness. On 16 January, Malone was the second person to be evicted from the "Celebrity Big Brother" House.
Press interviews were filmed on June 17, 2014, the cast was announced on June 19, 2014 and the HouseGuests moved into the "Big Brother" house on June 20, 2014. "Big Brother 16" began with a two-night premiere on June 25–26, 2014. On June 25, 2014, five days after the HouseGuests moved into the "Big Brother" house, eight of the 16 HouseGuests—Amber, Cody, Devin, Donny, Frankie, Joey, Nicole and Paola—were introduced, shown entering the house and taking part in the first HoH competition of the season, while on June 26, the eight HouseGuests who were not introduced the night before—Brittany, Caleb, Christine, Derrick, Hayden, Jocasta, Victoria and Zach—were introduced, shown entering the house and taking part in the second HoH competition. It was on the June 26 episode that the Team America and Battle of the Block twists were revealed.
